item.title: Police arrests 300 suspects linked to African cybercrime rings
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: African law enforcement authorities have arrested 306 suspects as part of 'Operation Red Card,' an INTERPOL-led international crackdown targeting cross-border cybercriminal networks. [...]

item.title: Critical flaw in Next.js lets hackers bypass authorization
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A critical severity vulnerability has been discovered in the Next.js open-source web development framework, potentially allowing attackers to bypass authorization checks. [...]

item.title: Hidden Threats: How Microsoft 365 Backups Store Risks for Future Attacks
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Acronis
item.description: Acronis Threat Research found 2M+ malicious URLs & 5,000+ malware instances in Microsoft 365 backup data—demonstrating how built-in security isn't always enough. Don't let threats persist in your cloud data. Strengthen your defenses. [...]

item.title: Google Gemini's Astra (screen sharing) rolls out on Android for some users
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: At MWC 2025, Google confirmed it was working on screen and video share capabilities for Gemini Live, codenamed "Project Astra". At that time, Google promised that the feature would begin rolling out soon, and now some users have spotted it in the wild. [...]

item.title: FBI warnings are true—fake file converters do push malware
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The FBI is warning that fake online document converters are being used to steal people's information and, in worst-case scenarios, lead to ransomware attacks. [...]

item.title: Cloudflare now blocks all unencrypted traffic to its API endpoints
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Cloudflare announced that it closed all HTTP connections and it is now accepting only secure, HTTPS connections for api.cloudflare.com. [...]

item.title: Microsoft Trusted Signing service abused to code-sign malware
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Cybercriminals are abusing Microsoft's Trusted Signing platform to code-sign malware executables with short-lived three-day certificates. [...]

item.title: Coinbase was primary target of recent GitHub Actions breaches
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Researchers have determined that Coinbase was the primary target in a recent GitHub Actions cascading supply chain attack that compromised secrets in hundreds of repositories. [...]

item.title: Oracle denies breach after hacker claims theft of 6 million data records
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Oracle denies it was breached after a threat actor claimed to be selling 6 million data records allegedly stolen from the company's Oracle Cloud federated SSO login servers [...]

item.title: Fake Semrush ads used to steal SEO professionals’ Google accounts
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new phishing campaign is targeting SEO professionals with malicious Semrush Google Ads that aim to steal their Google account credentials. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: Exchange Online bug mistakenly quarantines user emails
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft is investigating an Exchange Online bug causing anti-spam systems to mistakenly quarantine some users' emails. [...]
